title: Portfolio Project - Part 1

The dataset I will use is: [Carbon Majors Emissions Data].

text:
1.2 Description of Data

The dataset includes [12,551] rows and [7] columns.
Key variables:

variable1: [total_emissions]
variable2: [parent_entity]

Data types:

Initial observations:

with a simple sort I see that a coal company has the most co2 emissions

title: DataPrep
text:
library(tidyverse)

── Attaching core tidyverse packages ──────────────────────── tidyverse 2.0.0 ──
✔ dplyr     1.1.4     ✔ readr     2.1.5
✔ forcats   1.0.0     ✔ stringr   1.5.1
✔ ggplot2   3.5.1     ✔ tibble    3.2.1
✔ lubridate 1.9.4     ✔ tidyr     1.3.1
✔ purrr     1.0.2     
── Conflicts ────────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse_conflicts() ──
✖ dplyr::filter() masks stats::filter()
✖ dplyr::lag()    masks stats::lag()
ℹ Use the conflicted package (<http://conflicted.r-lib.org/>) to force all conflicts to become errors



# Option 1: tidytuesdayR package 
## install.packages("tidytuesdayR")

tuesdata <- tidytuesdayR::tt_load('2024-05-21')

---- Compiling #TidyTuesday Information for 2024-05-21 ----
--- There is 1 file available ---


── Downloading files ───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────

  1 of 1: "emissions.csv"

## OR
tuesdata <- tidytuesdayR::tt_load(2024, week = 21)

---- Compiling #TidyTuesday Information for 2024-05-21 ----
--- There is 1 file available ---


── Downloading files ───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────

  1 of 1: "emissions.csv"

emissions <- tuesdata$emissions


colorsVanLikes <- c(
  "dodgerblue2", 
  "#E31A1C", 
  "green4",
  "#6A3D9A", 
  "skyblue2", 
  "#FB9A99", 
  "#CAB2D6",
  "#FDBF6F", 
  "maroon", 
  "orchid1", 
  "deeppink1", 
  "blue1",
  "steelblue4",
  "darkturquoise", 
  "green1", 
  "darkorange4",
  "brown",
  "cyan",
  "cyan4",
  "coral",
  "darkgreen",
  "blue",
  "red4",
  "green4"
)


emissionsCleanParent <- emissions |>
  filter( commodity == "Oil & NGL",
          year >= 1970
          )|>
  select( -c( parent_type, 
              production_value, 
              production_unit
              ))|>
  mutate(total = as.numeric(total_emissions_MtCO2e)) |>
  group_by(parent_entity)|>
  mutate(avg_emissions = mean(total_emissions_MtCO2e))|>
  filter( avg_emissions >= 300)|>
  ungroup()

emissionsCleanCommodity <- emissions |>
  filter( year >= 1970
          )|>
  select( -c( parent_type, 
              production_value, 
              production_unit
              ))|>
  mutate(total = as.numeric(total_emissions_MtCO2e)) |>
  group_by(year, commodity)|>
  mutate(avg_emissions = mean(total_emissions_MtCO2e))|>
  filter( avg_emissions >= 0)|>
  ungroup()


emissionsCleanParent|>
  ggplot( aes( x = year,
               y = total_emissions_MtCO2e,
               group = parent_entity,
               color = parent_entity
               ))+
  theme_minimal()+
  scale_color_manual(values = colorsVanLikes)+
  geom_line()







emissionsCleanCommodity|>
  ggplot( aes( x = year,
               y = avg_emissions,
               group = commodity,
               color = commodity
               ))+
  theme_minimal()+
  scale_color_manual(values = colorsVanLikes)+
  geom_line()
